{"filePath": "d:\Repos\_pm\scripts\docker\install-docker.ps1", "content": "# Script para instalar Docker Engine no Windows (WSL2)
# Autor: GitHub Copilot
# Data: 2026-01-30
# Nota: Este script instala o Docker Engine via WSL2, n√£o o Docker Desktop

# Cores para output
$ErrorActionPreference = "Stop"

Write-Host "üê≥ Instalando Docker Engine via WSL2..." -ForegroundColor Cyan

# Fun√ß√£o para verificar se est√° rodando como administrador
function Test-Administrator {
    $currentUser = [Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity]::GetCurrent()
    $principal = New-Object Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal($currentUser)
    return $principal.IsInRole([Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole]::Administrator)
}

# Verificar privil√©gios de administrador
if (-not (Test-Administrator)) {
    Write-Host "‚ùå Este script precisa ser executado como Administrador!" -ForegroundColor Red
    Write-Host "üí° Clique com o bot√£o direito no PowerShell e selecione 'Executar como administrador'" -ForegroundColor Yellow
    exit 1
}

# Verificar se WSL est√° instalado
Write-Host "üîç Verificando instala√ß√£o do WSL..." -ForegroundColor Yellow

$wslInstalled = $false
try {
    $wslVersion = wsl --version 2>$null
    if ($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0) {
        $wslInstalled = $true
    }
} catch {
    $wslInstalled = $false
}

if (-not $wslInstalled) {
    Write-Host "üì¶ WSL n√£o est√° instalado. Instalando WSL2..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    
    try {
        wsl --install --no-distribution
        Write-Host "‚úÖ WSL2 instalado com sucesso!" -ForegroundColor Green
        Write-Host "‚ö†Ô∏è  √â necess√°rio reiniciar o computador para continuar." -ForegroundColor Yellow
        Write-Host "üí° Ap√≥s reiniciar, execute este script novamente." -ForegroundColor Cyan
        
        $restart = Read-Host "Deseja reiniciar agora? (s/n)"
        if ($restart -eq "s" -or $restart -eq "S") {
            Restart-Computer -Force
        }
        exit 0
    } catch {
        Write-Host "‚ùå Erro ao instalar WSL: $_" -ForegroundColor Red
        exit 1
    }
} else {
    Write-Host "‚úÖ WSL j√° est√° instalado" -ForegroundColor Green
}

# Verificar se existe uma distribui√ß√£o Linux instalada
Write-Host "üîç Verificando distribui√ß√µes Linux instaladas..." -ForegroundColor Yellow

$distros = wsl --list --quiet 2>$null | Where-Object { $_ -and $_.Trim() -ne "" }

if (-not $distros -or $distros.Count -eq 0) {
    Write-Host "üì¶ Nenhuma distribui√ß√£o Linux encontrada. Instalando Ubuntu..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    
    try {
        wsl --install -d Ubuntu
        Write-Host "‚úÖ Ubuntu instalado com sucesso!" -ForegroundColor Green
        Write-Host "‚ö†Ô∏è  Configure seu usu√°rio e senha no Ubuntu que ser√° aberto." -ForegroundColor Yellow
        Write-Host "üí° Ap√≥s configurar, execute este script novamente para instalar o Docker." -ForegroundColor Cyan
        exit 0
    } catch {
        Write-Host "‚ùå Erro ao instalar Ubuntu: $_" -ForegroundColor Red
        exit 1
    }
} else {
    Write-Host "‚úÖ Distribui√ß√£o Linux encontrada: $($distros[0])" -ForegroundColor Green
}

# Verificar se Docker j√° est√° instalado no WSL
Write-Host "üîç Verificando se Docker j√° est√° instalado no WSL..." -ForegroundColor Yellow

$dockerInstalled = wsl docker --version 2>$null
if ($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0 -and $dockerInstalled) {
    Write-Host "‚úÖ Docker j√° est√° instalado no WSL: $dockerInstalled" -ForegroundColor Green
    
    # Verificar se o servi√ßo est√° rodando
    $dockerRunning = wsl docker info 2>$null
    if ($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0) {
        Write-Host "‚úÖ Docker est√° rodando!" -ForegroundColor Green
    } else {
        Write-Host "‚ö†Ô∏è  Docker est√° instalado mas n√£o est√° rodando." -ForegroundColor Yellow
        Write-Host "üîÑ Iniciando servi√ßo Docker..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
        wsl sudo service docker start
        if ($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0) {
            Write-Host "‚úÖ Servi√ßo Docker iniciado com sucesso!" -ForegroundColor Green
        } else {
            Write-Host "‚ùå Erro ao iniciar servi√ßo Docker" -ForegroundColor Red
        }
    }
    exit 0
}

# Instalar Docker no WSL
Write-Host "üì¶ Instalando Docker Engine no WSL..." -ForegroundColor Yellow

# Script de instala√ß√£o do Docker para rodar no WSL
$dockerInstallScript = @'
#!/bin/bash
set -e

# Cores
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
CYAN='\033[0;36m'
NC='\033[0m'

echo -e "${CYAN}üê≥ Instalando Docker Engine...${NC}"

# Remover vers√µes antigas se existirem
echo -e "${YELLOW}üßπ Removendo vers√µes antigas do Docker (se existirem)...${NC}"
for pkg in docker.io docker-doc docker-compose docker-compose-v2 podman-docker containerd runc; do
    sudo apt-get remove -y $pkg 2>/dev/null || true
done

# Atualizar pacotes
echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Atualizando lista de pacotes...${NC}"
sudo apt-get update

# Instalar depend√™ncias
echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Instalando depend√™ncias...${NC}"
sudo apt-get install -y ca-certificates curl gnupg

# Adicionar chave GPG oficial do Docker
echo -e "${YELLOW}üîë Adicionando chave GPG do Docker...${NC}"
sudo install -m 0755 -d /etc/apt/keyrings
curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/gpg | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg --yes
sudo chmod a+r /etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg

# Adicionar reposit√≥rio do Docker
echo -e "${YELLOW}üìã Adicionando reposit√≥rio do Docker...${NC}"
echo \
  "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg] https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu \
  $(. /etc/os-release && echo "$VERSION_CODENAME") stable" | \
  sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list > /dev/null

# Atualizar e instalar Docker
echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Instalando Docker Engine...${NC}"
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install -y docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io docker-buildx-plugin docker-compose-plugin

# Adicionar usu√°rio ao grupo docker
echo -e "${YELLOW}üë§ Adicionando usu√°rio ao grupo docker...${NC}"
sudo usermod -aG docker $USER

# Iniciar servi√ßo Docker
echo -e "${YELLOW}üöÄ Iniciando servi√ßo Docker...${NC}"
sudo service docker start

# Verificar instala√ß√£o
echo -e "${YELLOW}üîç Verificando instala√ß√£o...${NC}"
sudo docker run --rm hello-world

echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Docker Engine instalado com sucesso!${NC}"
echo -e "${CYAN}üí° Para usar docker sem sudo, fa√ßa logout e login novamente ou execute: newgrp docker${NC}"
'@

# Salvar script tempor√°rio e executar no WSL
$tempScript = [System.IO.Path]::GetTempFileName() -replace '\.tmp$', '.sh'
$dockerInstallScript | Out-File -FilePath $tempScript -Encoding utf8 -NoNewline

# Converter caminho Windows para WSL
$wslPath = wsl wslpath -u ($tempScript -replace '\\', '/')

# Executar script no WSL
Write-Host "üöÄ Executando instala√ß√£o no WSL..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
wsl bash $wslPath

if ($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0) {
    Write-Host ""
    Write-Host "‚úÖ Docker Engine instalado com sucesso no WSL!" -ForegroundColor Green
    Write-Host ""
    Write-Host "üìã Para usar o Docker:" -ForegroundColor Cyan
    Write-Host "   ‚Ä¢ Abra o WSL (digite 'wsl' no terminal)" -ForegroundColor White
    Write-Host "   ‚Ä¢ Use comandos docker normalmente (docker run, docker ps, etc.)" -ForegroundColor White
    Write-Host ""
    Write-Host "üí° Dica: Para usar 'docker' diretamente do PowerShell, adicione ao seu perfil:" -ForegroundColor Yellow
    Write-Host '   function docker { wsl docker $args }' -ForegroundColor Gray
    Write-Host '   function docker-compose { wsl docker compose $args }' -ForegroundColor Gray
} else {
    Write-Host "‚ùå Erro durante a instala√ß√£o do Docker" -ForegroundColor Red
    exit 1
}

# Limpar arquivo tempor√°rio
Remove-Item -Path $tempScript -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
"}

{"filePath": "d:\Repos\_pm\scripts\docker\install-docker.sh", "content": "#!/bin/bash
# Script para instalar Docker Engine no Linux (Ubuntu/Debian)
# Autor: GitHub Copilot
# Data: 2026-01-30
# Nota: Este script instala o Docker Engine, n√£o o Docker Desktop

# Cores para output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
CYAN='\033[0;36m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

echo -e "${CYAN}üê≥ Instalando Docker Engine...${NC}"

# Fun√ß√£o para verificar se est√° rodando como root ou com sudo
check_privileges() {
    if [[ $EUID -ne 0 ]]; then
        if ! sudo -v &>/dev/null; then
            echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Este script precisa de privil√©gios de administrador!${NC}"
            echo -e "${YELLOW}üí° Execute com: sudo $0${NC}"
            exit 1
        fi
    fi
}

# Fun√ß√£o para detectar a distribui√ß√£o
detect_distro() {
    if [[ -f /etc/os-release ]]; then
        . /etc/os-release
        DISTRO=$ID
        DISTRO_VERSION=$VERSION_CODENAME
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Distribui√ß√£o detectada: $DISTRO ($DISTRO_VERSION)${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}‚ùå N√£o foi poss√≠vel detectar a distribui√ß√£o Linux${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
}

# Fun√ß√£o para verificar se Docker j√° est√° instalado
check_docker_installed() {
    if command -v docker &>/dev/null; then
        DOCKER_VERSION=$(docker --version 2>/dev/null)
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Docker j√° est√° instalado: $DOCKER_VERSION${NC}"
        
        # Verificar se o servi√ßo est√° rodando
        if docker info &>/dev/null; then
            echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Docker est√° rodando!${NC}"
        else
            echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  Docker est√° instalado mas n√£o est√° rodando.${NC}"
            echo -e "${YELLOW}üîÑ Iniciando servi√ßo Docker...${NC}"
            
            if sudo systemctl start docker 2>/dev/null || sudo service docker start 2>/dev/null; then
                echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Servi√ßo Docker iniciado com sucesso!${NC}"
            else
                echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Erro ao iniciar servi√ßo Docker${NC}"
                return 1
            fi
        fi
        
        # Verificar se o usu√°rio est√° no grupo docker
        if groups | grep -q docker; then
            echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Usu√°rio j√° est√° no grupo docker${NC}"
        else
            echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  Usu√°rio n√£o est√° no grupo docker${NC}"
            echo -e "${YELLOW}üë§ Adicionando usu√°rio ao grupo docker...${NC}"
            sudo usermod -aG docker $USER
            echo -e "${CYAN}üí° Fa√ßa logout e login novamente para aplicar as mudan√ßas${NC}"
        fi
        
        return 0
    fi
    return 1
}

# Fun√ß√£o para remover vers√µes antigas
remove_old_versions() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üßπ Removendo vers√µes antigas do Docker (se existirem)...${NC}"
    
    for pkg in docker.io docker-doc docker-compose docker-compose-v2 podman-docker containerd runc; do
        sudo apt-get remove -y $pkg 2>/dev/null || true
    done
}

# Fun√ß√£o para instalar Docker no Ubuntu/Debian
install_docker_debian() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Atualizando lista de pacotes...${NC}"
    sudo apt-get update
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Instalando depend√™ncias...${NC}"
    sudo apt-get install -y ca-certificates curl gnupg
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üîë Adicionando chave GPG do Docker...${NC}"
    sudo install -m 0755 -d /etc/apt/keyrings
    
    # Determinar a URL correta baseada na distro
    local docker_url="https://download.docker.com/linux/$DISTRO"
    
    curl -fsSL "$docker_url/gpg" | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg --yes
    sudo chmod a+r /etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìã Adicionando reposit√≥rio do Docker...${NC}"
    echo \
        "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg] $docker_url \
        $DISTRO_VERSION stable" | \
        sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list > /dev/null
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Instalando Docker Engine...${NC}"
    sudo apt-get update
    sudo apt-get install -y docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io docker-buildx-plugin docker-compose-plugin
}

# Fun√ß√£o para instalar Docker no Fedora/RHEL/CentOS
install_docker_rhel() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Instalando depend√™ncias...${NC}"
    sudo dnf -y install dnf-plugins-core
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìã Adicionando reposit√≥rio do Docker...${NC}"
    sudo dnf config-manager --add-repo https://download.docker.com/linux/fedora/docker-ce.repo
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Instalando Docker Engine...${NC}"
    sudo dnf install -y docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io docker-buildx-plugin docker-compose-plugin
}

# Fun√ß√£o para configurar Docker p√≥s-instala√ß√£o
configure_docker() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üë§ Adicionando usu√°rio ao grupo docker...${NC}"
    sudo usermod -aG docker $USER
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üîß Habilitando Docker para iniciar no boot...${NC}"
    if command -v systemctl &>/dev/null; then
        sudo systemctl enable docker.service
        sudo systemctl enable containerd.service
    fi
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üöÄ Iniciando servi√ßo Docker...${NC}"
    if command -v systemctl &>/dev/null; then
        sudo systemctl start docker
    else
        sudo service docker start
    fi
}

# Fun√ß√£o para verificar instala√ß√£o
verify_installation() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üîç Verificando instala√ß√£o...${NC}"
    
    # Usar sudo para o teste j√° que o usu√°rio precisa fazer logout/login para grupo docker
    if sudo docker run --rm hello-world; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Docker Engine instalado com sucesso!${NC}"
        return 0
    else
        echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Erro na verifica√ß√£o do Docker${NC}"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Execu√ß√£o principal
main() {
    check_privileges
    detect_distro
    
    # Verificar se j√° est√° instalado
    if check_docker_installed; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}üéâ Docker j√° est√° configurado e funcionando!${NC}"
        exit 0
    fi
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Iniciando instala√ß√£o do Docker Engine...${NC}"
    
    # Remover vers√µes antigas
    remove_old_versions
    
    # Instalar baseado na distribui√ß√£o
    case $DISTRO in
        ubuntu|debian)
            install_docker_debian
            ;;
        fedora|rhel|centos)
            install_docker_rhel
            ;;
        *)
            echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Distribui√ß√£o '$DISTRO' n√£o suportada automaticamente${NC}"
            echo -e "${YELLOW}üí° Consulte: https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/${NC}"
            exit 1
            ;;
    esac
    
    # Configurar p√≥s-instala√ß√£o
    configure_docker
    
    # Verificar instala√ß√£o
    verify_installation
    
    echo ""
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Docker Engine instalado com sucesso!${NC}"
    echo ""
    echo -e "${CYAN}üìã Pr√≥ximos passos:${NC}"
    echo -e "${WHITE}   ‚Ä¢ Fa√ßa logout e login novamente para usar docker sem sudo${NC}"
    echo -e "${WHITE}   ‚Ä¢ Ou execute: newgrp docker${NC}"
    echo ""
    echo -e "${CYAN}üí° Comandos √∫teis:${NC}"
    echo -e "${WHITE}   ‚Ä¢ docker --version     - Verificar vers√£o${NC}"
    echo -e "${WHITE}   ‚Ä¢ docker ps            - Listar containers${NC}"
    echo -e "${WHITE}   ‚Ä¢ docker compose       - Gerenciar multi-containers${NC}"
}

# Executar
main "$@"
"}

{"content": "# üê≥ Docker Scripts

Scripts for Docker Engine installation (not Docker Desktop).

## üìã Available Scripts

### `install-docker.ps1` (Windows)

Installs Docker Engine on Windows via WSL2.

**Why WSL2?**
Docker Engine depends on Linux kernel features. On Windows 10/11, the only way to run Docker Engine without Docker Desktop is through WSL2.

**Features:**
- ‚úÖ Checks and installs WSL2 if needed
- ‚úÖ Checks and installs Ubuntu if no Linux distribution exists
- ‚úÖ Installs Docker Engine inside WSL
- ‚úÖ Configures user in docker group
- ‚úÖ Idempotent - can be run multiple times

**Requirements:**
- Windows 10 version 2004+ or Windows 11
- Administrator privileges
- Virtualization enabled in BIOS

**Usage:**
```powershell
# Run as Administrator
.\install-docker.ps1
```

**After installation:**
```powershell
# Access WSL
wsl

# Use docker normally
docker --version
docker run hello-world
```

---

### `install-docker.sh` (Linux)

Installs Docker Engine on Linux distributions.

**Supported distributions:**
- ‚úÖ Ubuntu
- ‚úÖ Debian
- ‚úÖ Fedora
- ‚úÖ RHEL/CentOS

**Features:**
- ‚úÖ Automatically detects the distribution
- ‚úÖ Removes old Docker versions
- ‚úÖ Installs Docker CE, CLI, containerd, buildx and compose
- ‚úÖ Configures to start on boot
- ‚úÖ Adds user to docker group
- ‚úÖ Idempotent - can be run multiple times

**Usage:**
```bash
# Give execution permission
chmod +x install-docker.sh

# Run
./install-docker.sh
# or
sudo ./install-docker.sh
```

**After installation:**
```bash
# Logout/login or run
newgrp docker

# Test
docker --version
docker run hello-world
```

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Important Note

These scripts install **Docker Engine** (open source), not Docker Desktop. Docker Desktop has different licensing for commercial use.
", "filePath": "d:\Repos\_pm\scripts\.english-version\docker\README.md"}

{"content": "# üîê SSH Scripts

Scripts for generating and managing SSH keys.

## üìã Available Scripts

### `generate-ssh-key.ps1` (Windows)

Generates Ed25519 SSH keys on Windows.

**Features:**
- ‚úÖ Generates SSH keys using Ed25519 algorithm (more secure and modern)
- ‚úÖ Detects existing keys and offers options
- ‚úÖ Displays the public key for easy copying
- ‚úÖ Creates `.ssh` directory automatically

**Parameters:**
| Parameter | Required | Description |
|-----------|----------|-------------|
| `-Email` | No* | Email to identify the key |
| `-Name` | No* | Key file name |

*If not provided, will be requested interactively.

**Usage:**
```powershell
# Interactive
.\generate-ssh-key.ps1

# With parameters
.\generate-ssh-key.ps1 -Email "your@email.com" -Name "github"
```

**Handling existing keys:**
If a key with the same name already exists, the script offers:
- ‚Ü©Ô∏è **ENTER** - Overwrite the existing key
- ‚úèÔ∏è **New name** - Generate with another name
- ‚õî **"exit"** - Cancel operation

---

### `generate-ssh-key.sh` (Linux/macOS)

Generates Ed25519 SSH keys on Linux and macOS.

**Features:**
- ‚úÖ Generates SSH keys using Ed25519 algorithm
- ‚úÖ Detects existing keys and offers options
- ‚úÖ Displays the public key for easy copying
- ‚úÖ Creates `.ssh` directory automatically

**Usage:**
```bash
# Give execution permission
chmod +x generate-ssh-key.sh

# Interactive
./generate-ssh-key.sh

# With parameters
./generate-ssh-key.sh "your@email.com" "github"
```

## üí° After generating the key

1. Copy the public key displayed in the terminal
2. Add it to the desired service:
   - **GitHub**: Settings ‚Üí SSH and GPG keys ‚Üí New SSH key
   - **GitLab**: Preferences ‚Üí SSH Keys
   - **Azure DevOps**: User settings ‚Üí SSH public keys
   - **Bitbucket**: Personal settings ‚Üí SSH keys

## üîí About Ed25519

The Ed25519 algorithm is recommended because:
- ‚úÖ More secure than RSA
- ‚úÖ Smaller and faster keys
- ‚úÖ Resistant to side-channel attacks

{"content": "# Script to install Docker Engine on Windows (WSL2)
# Author: GitHub Copilot
# Date: 2026-01-30
# Note: This script installs Docker Engine via WSL2, not Docker Desktop

# Output colors
$ErrorActionPreference = "Stop"

Write-Host "üê≥ Installing Docker Engine via WSL2..." -ForegroundColor Cyan

# Function to check if running as administrator
function Test-Administrator {
    $currentUser = [Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity]::GetCurrent()
    $principal = New-Object Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal($currentUser)
    return $principal.IsInRole([Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole]::Administrator)
}

# Check administrator privileges
if (-not (Test-Administrator)) {
    Write-Host "‚ùå This script needs to be run as Administrator!" -ForegroundColor Red
    Write-Host "üí° Right-click on PowerShell and select 'Run as administrator'" -ForegroundColor Yellow
    exit 1
}

# Check if WSL is installed
Write-Host "üîç Checking WSL installation..." -ForegroundColor Yellow

$wslInstalled = $false
try {
    $wslVersion = wsl --version 2>$null
    if ($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0) {
        $wslInstalled = $true
    }
} catch {
    $wslInstalled = $false
}

if (-not $wslInstalled) {
    Write-Host "üì¶ WSL is not installed. Installing WSL2..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    
    try {
        wsl --install --no-distribution
        Write-Host "‚úÖ WSL2 installed successfully!" -ForegroundColor Green
        Write-Host "‚ö†Ô∏è  A computer restart is required to continue." -ForegroundColor Yellow
        Write-Host "üí° After restarting, run this script again." -ForegroundColor Cyan
        
        $restart = Read-Host "Do you want to restart now? (y/n)"
        if ($restart -eq "y" -or $restart -eq "Y") {
            Restart-Computer -Force
        }
        exit 0
    } catch {
        Write-Host "‚ùå Error installing WSL: $_" -ForegroundColor Red
        exit 1
    }
} else {
    Write-Host "‚úÖ WSL is already installed" -ForegroundColor Green
}

# Check if a Linux distribution is installed
Write-Host "üîç Checking installed Linux distributions..." -ForegroundColor Yellow

$distros = wsl --list --quiet 2>$null | Where-Object { $_ -and $_.Trim() -ne "" }

if (-not $distros -or $distros.Count -eq 0) {
    Write-Host "üì¶ No Linux distribution found. Installing Ubuntu..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    
    try {
        wsl --install -d Ubuntu
        Write-Host "‚úÖ Ubuntu installed successfully!" -ForegroundColor Green
        Write-Host "‚ö†Ô∏è  Configure your username and password in the Ubuntu window that will open." -ForegroundColor Yellow
        Write-Host "üí° After configuring, run this script again to install Docker." -ForegroundColor Cyan
        exit 0
    } catch {
        Write-Host "‚ùå Error installing Ubuntu: $_" -ForegroundColor Red
        exit 1
    }
} else {
    Write-Host "‚úÖ Linux distribution found: $($distros[0])" -ForegroundColor Green
}

# Check if Docker is already installed in WSL
Write-Host "üîç Checking if Docker is already installed in WSL..." -ForegroundColor Yellow

$dockerInstalled = wsl docker --version 2>$null
if ($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0 -and $dockerInstalled) {
    Write-Host "‚úÖ Docker is already installed in WSL: $dockerInstalled" -ForegroundColor Green
    
    # Check if the service is running
    $dockerRunning = wsl docker info 2>$null
    if ($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0) {
        Write-Host "‚úÖ Docker is running!" -ForegroundColor Green
    } else {
        Write-Host "‚ö†Ô∏è  Docker is installed but not running." -ForegroundColor Yellow
        Write-Host "üîÑ Starting Docker service..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
        wsl sudo service docker start
        if ($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0) {
            Write-Host "‚úÖ Docker service started successfully!" -ForegroundColor Green
        } else {
            Write-Host "‚ùå Error starting Docker service" -ForegroundColor Red
        }
    }
    exit 0
}

# Install Docker in WSL
Write-Host "üì¶ Installing Docker Engine in WSL..." -ForegroundColor Yellow

# Docker installation script to run in WSL
$dockerInstallScript = @'
#!/bin/bash
set -e

# Colors
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
CYAN='\033[0;36m'
NC='\033[0m'

echo -e "${CYAN}üê≥ Installing Docker Engine...${NC}"

# Remove old versions if they exist
echo -e "${YELLOW}üßπ Removing old Docker versions (if any)...${NC}"
for pkg in docker.io docker-doc docker-compose docker-compose-v2 podman-docker containerd runc; do
    sudo apt-get remove -y $pkg 2>/dev/null || true
done

# Update packages
echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Updating package list...${NC}"
sudo apt-get update

# Install dependencies
echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Installing dependencies...${NC}"
sudo apt-get install -y ca-certificates curl gnupg

# Add Docker's official GPG key
echo -e "${YELLOW}üîë Adding Docker GPG key...${NC}"
sudo install -m 0755 -d /etc/apt/keyrings
curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/gpg | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg --yes
sudo chmod a+r /etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg

# Add Docker repository
echo -e "${YELLOW}üìã Adding Docker repository...${NC}"
echo \
  "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg] https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu \
  $(. /etc/os-release && echo "$VERSION_CODENAME") stable" | \
  sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list > /dev/null

# Update and install Docker
echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Installing Docker Engine...${NC}"
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install -y docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io docker-buildx-plugin docker-compose-plugin

# Add user to docker group
echo -e "${YELLOW}üë§ Adding user to docker group...${NC}"
sudo usermod -aG docker $USER

# Start Docker service
echo -e "${YELLOW}üöÄ Starting Docker service...${NC}"
sudo service docker start

# Verify installation
echo -e "${YELLOW}üîç Verifying installation...${NC}"
sudo docker run --rm hello-world

echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Docker Engine installed successfully!${NC}"
echo -e "${CYAN}üí° To use docker without sudo, logout and login again or run: newgrp docker${NC}"
'@

# Save temporary script and run in WSL
$tempScript = [System.IO.Path]::GetTempFileName() -replace '\.tmp$', '.sh'
$dockerInstallScript | Out-File -FilePath $tempScript -Encoding utf8 -NoNewline

# Convert Windows path to WSL
$wslPath = wsl wslpath -u ($tempScript -replace '\\', '/')

# Run script in WSL
Write-Host "üöÄ Running installation in WSL..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
wsl bash $wslPath

if ($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0) {
    Write-Host ""
    Write-Host "‚úÖ Docker Engine installed successfully in WSL!" -ForegroundColor Green
    Write-Host ""
    Write-Host "üìã To use Docker:" -ForegroundColor Cyan
    Write-Host "   ‚Ä¢ Open WSL (type 'wsl' in terminal)" -ForegroundColor White
    Write-Host "   ‚Ä¢ Use docker commands normally (docker run, docker ps, etc.)" -ForegroundColor White
    Write-Host ""
    Write-Host "üí° Tip: To use 'docker' directly from PowerShell, add to your profile:" -ForegroundColor Yellow
    Write-Host '   function docker { wsl docker $args }' -ForegroundColor Gray
    Write-Host '   function docker-compose { wsl docker compose $args }' -ForegroundColor Gray
} else {
    Write-Host "‚ùå Error during Docker installation" -ForegroundColor Red
    exit 1
}

# Clean up temporary file
Remove-Item -Path $tempScript -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
", "filePath": "d:\Repos\_pm\scripts\.english-version\docker\install-docker.ps1"}

{"content": "#!/bin/bash
# Script to install Docker Engine on Linux (Ubuntu/Debian)
# Author: GitHub Copilot
# Date: 2026-01-30
# Note: This script installs Docker Engine, not Docker Desktop

# Output colors
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
CYAN='\033[0;36m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

echo -e "${CYAN}üê≥ Installing Docker Engine...${NC}"

# Function to check if running as root or with sudo
check_privileges() {
    if [[ $EUID -ne 0 ]]; then
        if ! sudo -v &>/dev/null; then
            echo -e "${RED}‚ùå This script requires administrator privileges!${NC}"
            echo -e "${YELLOW}üí° Run with: sudo $0${NC}"
            exit 1
        fi
    fi
}

# Function to detect the distribution
detect_distro() {
    if [[ -f /etc/os-release ]]; then
        . /etc/os-release
        DISTRO=$ID
        DISTRO_VERSION=$VERSION_CODENAME
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Distribution detected: $DISTRO ($DISTRO_VERSION)${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Could not detect the Linux distribution${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
}

# Function to check if Docker is already installed
check_docker_installed() {
    if command -v docker &>/dev/null; then
        DOCKER_VERSION=$(docker --version 2>/dev/null)
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Docker is already installed: $DOCKER_VERSION${NC}"
        
        # Check if the service is running
        if docker info &>/dev/null; then
            echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Docker is running!${NC}"
        else
            echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  Docker is installed but not running.${NC}"
            echo -e "${YELLOW}üîÑ Starting Docker service...${NC}"
            
            if sudo systemctl start docker 2>/dev/null || sudo service docker start 2>/dev/null; then
                echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Docker service started successfully!${NC}"
            else
                echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Error starting Docker service${NC}"
                return 1
            fi
        fi
        
        # Check if user is in docker group
        if groups | grep -q docker; then
            echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ User is already in docker group${NC}"
        else
            echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  User is not in docker group${NC}"
            echo -e "${YELLOW}üë§ Adding user to docker group...${NC}"
            sudo usermod -aG docker $USER
            echo -e "${CYAN}üí° Logout and login again to apply the changes${NC}"
        fi
        
        return 0
    fi
    return 1
}

# Function to remove old versions
remove_old_versions() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üßπ Removing old Docker versions (if any)...${NC}"
    
    for pkg in docker.io docker-doc docker-compose docker-compose-v2 podman-docker containerd runc; do
        sudo apt-get remove -y $pkg 2>/dev/null || true
    done
}

# Function to install Docker on Ubuntu/Debian
install_docker_debian() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Updating package list...${NC}"
    sudo apt-get update
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Installing dependencies...${NC}"
    sudo apt-get install -y ca-certificates curl gnupg
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üîë Adding Docker GPG key...${NC}"
    sudo install -m 0755 -d /etc/apt/keyrings
    
    # Determine the correct URL based on distro
    local docker_url="https://download.docker.com/linux/$DISTRO"
    
    curl -fsSL "$docker_url/gpg" | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg --yes
    sudo chmod a+r /etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìã Adding Docker repository...${NC}"
    echo \
        "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/docker.gpg] $docker_url \
        $DISTRO_VERSION stable" | \
        sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list > /dev/null
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Installing Docker Engine...${NC}"
    sudo apt-get update
    sudo apt-get install -y docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io docker-buildx-plugin docker-compose-plugin
}

# Function to install Docker on Fedora/RHEL/CentOS
install_docker_rhel() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Installing dependencies...${NC}"
    sudo dnf -y install dnf-plugins-core
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìã Adding Docker repository...${NC}"
    sudo dnf config-manager --add-repo https://download.docker.com/linux/fedora/docker-ce.repo
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Installing Docker Engine...${NC}"
    sudo dnf install -y docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io docker-buildx-plugin docker-compose-plugin
}

# Function to configure Docker post-installation
configure_docker() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üë§ Adding user to docker group...${NC}"
    sudo usermod -aG docker $USER
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üîß Enabling Docker to start on boot...${NC}"
    if command -v systemctl &>/dev/null; then
        sudo systemctl enable docker.service
        sudo systemctl enable containerd.service
    fi
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üöÄ Starting Docker service...${NC}"
    if command -v systemctl &>/dev/null; then
        sudo systemctl start docker
    else
        sudo service docker start
    fi
}

# Function to verify installation
verify_installation() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üîç Verifying installation...${NC}"
    
    # Use sudo for the test since user needs to logout/login for docker group
    if sudo docker run --rm hello-world; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Docker Engine installed successfully!${NC}"
        return 0
    else
        echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Error verifying Docker${NC}"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Main execution
main() {
    check_privileges
    detect_distro
    
    # Check if already installed
    if check_docker_installed; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}üéâ Docker is already configured and working!${NC}"
        exit 0
    fi
    
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Starting Docker Engine installation...${NC}"
    
    # Remove old versions
    remove_old_versions
    
    # Install based on distribution
    case $DISTRO in
        ubuntu|debian)
            install_docker_debian
            ;;
        fedora|rhel|centos)
            install_docker_rhel
            ;;
        *)
            echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Distribution '$DISTRO' not automatically supported${NC}"
            echo -e "${YELLOW}üí° See: https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/${NC}"
            exit 1
            ;;
    esac
    
    # Post-installation configuration
    configure_docker
    
    # Verify installation
    verify_installation
    
    echo ""
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Docker Engine installed successfully!${NC}"
    echo ""
    echo -e "${CYAN}üìã Next steps:${NC}"
    echo -e "${WHITE}   ‚Ä¢ Logout and login again to use docker without sudo${NC}"
    echo -e "${WHITE}   ‚Ä¢ Or run: newgrp docker${NC}"
    echo ""
    echo -e "${CYAN}üí° Useful commands:${NC}"
    echo -e "${WHITE}   ‚Ä¢ docker --version     - Check version${NC}"
    echo -e "${WHITE}   ‚Ä¢ docker ps            - List containers${NC}"
    echo -e "${WHITE}   ‚Ä¢ docker compose       - Manage multi-containers${NC}"
}

# Run
main "$@"
", "filePath": "d:\Repos\_pm\scripts\.english-version\docker\install-docker.sh"}

{"content": "#!/bin/bash

# ANSI Colors
YELLOW='\033[33m'
CYAN='\033[36m'
WHITE='\033[37m'
GRAY='\033[90m'
GREEN='\033[32m'
RED='\033[31m'
RESET='\033[0m'

# Function to check and handle existing keys
resolve_existing_key() {
    local key_name="$1"
    local ssh_directory="$2"
    
    # Remove "id_" prefix if user typed it
    if [[ "$key_name" == id_* ]]; then
        key_name="${key_name:3}"
    fi
    
    local key_path="$ssh_directory/id_$key_name"
    
    # If key doesn't exist, return the name
    if [[ ! -f "$key_path" ]]; then
        echo "$key_name"
        return
    fi
    
    # Key exists - show information
    echo -e "\n${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  Key '$key_path' already exists!${RESET}"
    
    # Show existing public key content
    local public_key_path="$key_path.pub"
    if [[ -f "$public_key_path" ]]; then
        echo -e "\n${CYAN}üìÑ Existing public key content:${RESET}"
        echo -e "${WHITE}$(cat "$public_key_path")${RESET}"
    fi
    
    echo -e "\n${GRAY}ü§î What would you like to do?${RESET}"
    echo -e "${GRAY}  ‚Ü©Ô∏è ENTER - Overwrite the existing file${RESET}"
    echo -e "${GRAY}  ‚úèÔ∏è Type a new name - Generate with another name${RESET}"
    echo -e "${GRAY}  ‚õî Type 'exit' or press Ctrl+C to cancel${RESET}"
    
    # Capture input
    echo -en "\n${GRAY}üëâ Type: ${RESET}"
    read -r response
    
    if [[ -z "$response" ]]; then
        # ENTER pressed - overwrite
        echo -e "\n${YELLOW}üîÑ Overwriting existing file...${RESET}"
        echo "$key_name"
        return
    fi
    
    # Convert to lowercase
    local response_lower=$(echo "$response" | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]')
    
    if [[ "$response_lower" == "exit" ]] || [[ "$response_lower" == "e" ]] || [[ "$response_lower" == "stop" ]]; then
        # "exit" typed
        echo -e "\n${RED}‚ùå Operation cancelled.${RESET}"
        exit 0
    else
        # New name typed - check recursively
        resolve_existing_key "$response" "$ssh_directory"
    fi
}

# Parameters
email="$1"
name="$2"

# If email was not provided, request it
if [[ -z "$email" ]]; then
    echo -n "üìß Enter email: "
    read -r email
fi

# Extract email prefix
email_prefix="${email%%@*}"

# If name was not provided, request it
if [[ -z "$name" ]]; then
    echo -en "${GRAY}üîë Enter key name (leave blank to use ${RESET}"
    echo -en "${YELLOW}$email_prefix${RESET}"
    echo -en "${GRAY}): ${RESET}"
    read -r name
fi

# If name is blank, use prefix before @ from email
if [[ -z "$name" ]]; then
    name="$email_prefix"
    echo -e "${GRAY}‚ú® Using '${RESET}${YELLOW}$email_prefix${RESET}${GRAY}' as key name (extracted from email)${RESET}"
fi

# Remove "id_" prefix if user typed it
if [[ "$name" == id_* ]]; then
    name="${name:3}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìå Removed duplicate 'id_' prefix. Using: $name${RESET}"
fi

# Build complete file path (always in ~/.ssh)
ssh_dir="$HOME/.ssh"
if [[ ! -d "$ssh_dir" ]]; then
    mkdir -p "$ssh_dir"
    echo -e "${GREEN}üìÅ .ssh directory created at: $ssh_dir${RESET}"
fi

# Check and resolve key name (handling duplicates)
name=$(resolve_existing_key "$name" "$ssh_dir")
key_path="$ssh_dir/id_$name"

echo -e "\n${CYAN}üîê Generating SSH key id_$name${RESET}"
echo -e "${WHITE}üìù ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C \"$email\" -f \"$key_path\" -N \"\"\n${RESET}"

# Run ssh-keygen (with empty passphrase and overwrite without asking)
yes y 2>/dev/null | ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "$email" -f "$key_path" -N ""

# Check if key was generated successfully
if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
    echo -e "\n${GREEN}=================================${RESET}"
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ SSH key generated successfully!${RESET}"
    echo -e "${GREEN}=================================${RESET}"
    
    # Show public key content
    public_key_path="$key_path.pub"
    
    if [[ -f "$public_key_path" ]]; then
        echo -e "\n${CYAN}üìã Public key content (copy the text below):${RESET}"
        echo -e "${WHITE}$(cat "$public_key_path")${RESET}"
    else
        echo -e "\n${RED}‚ö†Ô∏è  Warning: Could not find public key file at: $public_key_path${RESET}"
    fi
else
    echo -e "\n${RED}‚ùå Error generating SSH key!${RESET}"
fi
", "filePath": "d:\Repos\_pm\scripts\.english-version\ssh\generate-ssh-key.sh"}

{"content": "#!/bin/bash
# Script to install custom Oh My Posh theme on Ubuntu
# Author: GitHub Copilot
# Date: 2026-01-15

# Output colors
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
CYAN='\033[0;36m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

echo -e "${CYAN}üé® Installing custom Oh My Posh theme...${NC}"

# Check if Oh My Posh is installed
echo -e "${YELLOW}üîç Checking Oh My Posh installation...${NC}"

if ! command -v oh-my-posh &> /dev/null; then
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Oh My Posh is not installed!${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üì¶ Installing Oh My Posh...${NC}"
    
    # Install Oh My Posh via curl (official method)
    if curl -s https://ohmyposh.dev/install.sh | bash -s; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Oh My Posh installed successfully!${NC}"
        
        # Add to PATH if needed
        if [[ ":$PATH:" != *":/usr/local/bin:"* ]]; then
            export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin
        fi
        
        echo -e "${CYAN}üí° You may need to restart the terminal to use Oh My Posh${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Error installing Oh My Posh${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}üí° Try installing manually: curl -s https://ohmyposh.dev/install.sh | bash -s${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Oh My Posh is already installed${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üîÑ Updating Oh My Posh...${NC}"
    
    if sudo oh-my-posh upgrade --force; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Oh My Posh updated successfully!${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è  Could not update, but continuing with current version${NC}"
    fi
fi

# Theme URL
THEME_URL="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pdmartins/scripts/refs/heads/main/oh-my-posh/blocks.emoji.omp.json"

# Oh My Posh themes directory
THEMES_PATH="${HOME}/.poshthemes"

# Theme file name
THEME_NAME="blocks.emoji.omp.json"
THEME_FILE_PATH="${THEMES_PATH}/${THEME_NAME}"

echo -e "${YELLOW}üìÅ Themes directory: ${THEMES_PATH}${NC}"

# Create directory if it doesn't exist
if [ ! -d "$THEMES_PATH" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìÇ Creating themes directory...${NC}"
    mkdir -p "$THEMES_PATH"
fi

# Download theme
echo -e "${YELLOW}‚¨áÔ∏è  Downloading theme from GitHub...${NC}"
if curl -fsSL "$THEME_URL" -o "$THEME_FILE_PATH"; then
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Theme downloaded successfully: ${THEME_FILE_PATH}${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${RED}‚ùå Error downloading theme${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

# Detect shell (bash or zsh)
SHELL_NAME=$(basename "$SHELL")
if [ "$SHELL_NAME" = "zsh" ]; then
    PROFILE_FILE="${HOME}/.zshrc"
    INIT_COMMAND="eval \"\$(oh-my-posh init zsh --config ${THEME_FILE_PATH})\""
else
    PROFILE_FILE="${HOME}/.bashrc"
    INIT_COMMAND="eval \"\$(oh-my-posh init bash --config ${THEME_FILE_PATH})\""
fi

echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Configuring profile: ${PROFILE_FILE}${NC}"

# Create profile if it doesn't exist
if [ ! -f "$PROFILE_FILE" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üìù Creating profile file...${NC}"
    touch "$PROFILE_FILE"
fi

# Check if Oh My Posh configuration already exists
if grep -q "oh-my-posh init" "$PROFILE_FILE"; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}üîÑ Updating existing Oh My Posh configuration in profile...${NC}"
    
    # Remove old oh-my-posh lines
    sed -i '/oh-my-posh init/d' "$PROFILE_FILE"
    
    # Add new configuration
    echo "$INIT_COMMAND" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
    
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Oh My Posh configuration updated in profile${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ûï Adding Oh My Posh to profile...${NC}"
    
    # Add blank line if file is not empty
    if [ -s "$PROFILE_FILE" ]; then
        echo "" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
    fi
    
    # Add configuration
    echo "$INIT_COMMAND" >> "$PROFILE_FILE"
    
    echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ Oh My Posh added to profile${NC}"
fi

echo -e "\n${GREEN}‚ú® Installation complete!${NC}"
echo -e "${CYAN}üìã To apply changes, run:${NC}"
echo -e "   ${NC}source ${PROFILE_FILE}${NC}"
echo -e "\n${CYAN}üí° Or close and reopen the terminal${NC}"
", "filePath": "d:\Repos\_pm\scripts\.english-version\oh-my-posh\install-omp-theme.sh"}

{"content": "<#
.SYNOPSIS
    Exports an Azure Resource Group as an ARM Template.

.DESCRIPTION
    This script connects to an Azure tenant, exports all resources from a Resource Group
    as an ARM Template, and saves it locally for later migration or backup.

.PARAMETER TenantId
    ID of the Azure tenant where the Resource Group is located.

.PARAMETER SubscriptionId
    ID of the subscription where the Resource Group is located.

.PARAMETER ResourceGroupName
    Name of the Resource Group to export.

.PARAMETER ExportPath
    Local path where files will be saved. Default: .\azure-migration

.PARAMETER SkipLogin
    If specified, skips login (useful if already authenticated).

.EXAMPLE
    .\Export-AzureResourceGroup.ps1 -TenantId "xxx" -SubscriptionId "yyy" -ResourceGroupName "my-rg"

.EXAMPLE
    .\Export-AzureResourceGroup.ps1 -TenantId "xxx" -SubscriptionId "yyy" -ResourceGroupName "my-rg" -ExportPath "D:\Backup" -SkipLogin

.NOTES
    Author: Pedro
    Requires: Azure CLI installed
#>

[CmdletBinding()]
param (
    [Parameter(Mandatory = $false, HelpMessage = "Azure tenant ID")]
    [string]$TenantId,

    [Parameter(Mandatory = $false, HelpMessage = "Azure subscription ID")]
    [string]$SubscriptionId,

    [Parameter(Mandatory = $false, HelpMessage = "Name of the Resource Group to export")]
    [string]$ResourceGroupName,

    [Parameter(Mandatory = $false, HelpMessage = "Path to save the files")]
    [string]$ExportPath,

    [Parameter(Mandatory = $false, HelpMessage = "Skip login if already authenticated")]
    [switch]$SkipLogin
)

# === CHECK EXECUTION POLICY ===
$currentPolicy = Get-ExecutionPolicy -Scope CurrentUser
$effectivePolicy = Get-ExecutionPolicy

if ($effectivePolicy -eq "Restricted") {
    Write-Host ""
    Write-Host "‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê" -ForegroundColor Red
    Write-Host "‚ö†Ô∏è  EXECUTION POLICY BLOCKED" -ForegroundColor Red
    Write-Host "‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê" -ForegroundColor Red
    Write-Host ""
    Write-Host "The current execution policy does not allow running scripts." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    Write-Host ""
    Write-Host "üí° Options to resolve:" -ForegroundColor Cyan
    Write-Host ""
    Write-Host "   Option 1 - Run this script only (recommended):" -ForegroundColor White
    Write-Host "   powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File .\Export-AzureResourceGroup.ps1" -ForegroundColor Gray
    Write-Host ""
    Write-Host "   Option 2 - Change policy for current user:" -ForegroundColor White
    Write-Host "   Set-ExecutionPolicy -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned -Scope CurrentUser" -ForegroundColor Gray
    Write-Host ""
    exit 1
}

# === HEADER ===
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "‚òÅÔ∏è  AZURE RESOURCE GROUP EXPORTER" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host ""

# === REQUEST MISSING PARAMETERS ===
if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($TenantId)) {
    Write-Host "üîë Tenant ID:" -ForegroundColor Yellow -NoNewline
    Write-Host " (find it at: Azure Portal > Azure Active Directory > Overview)" -ForegroundColor DarkGray
    $TenantId = Read-Host "   Enter Tenant ID"
    
    if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($TenantId)) {
        Write-Host "‚ùå Tenant ID is required." -ForegroundColor Red
        exit 1
    }
    Write-Host ""
}

if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($SubscriptionId)) {
    Write-Host "üé´ Subscription ID:" -ForegroundColor Yellow -NoNewline
    Write-Host " (find it at: Azure Portal > Subscriptions)" -ForegroundColor DarkGray
    $SubscriptionId = Read-Host "   Enter Subscription ID"
    
    if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($SubscriptionId)) {
        Write-Host "‚ùå Subscription ID is required." -ForegroundColor Red
        exit 1
    }
    Write-Host ""
}

if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($ResourceGroupName)) {
    Write-Host "üì¶ Resource Group Name:" -ForegroundColor Yellow -NoNewline
    Write-Host " (name of the Resource Group to export)" -ForegroundColor DarkGray
    $ResourceGroupName = Read-Host "   Enter Resource Group name"
    
    if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($ResourceGroupName)) {
        Write-Host "‚ùå Resource Group Name is required." -ForegroundColor Red
        exit 1
    }
    Write-Host ""
}

if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($ExportPath)) {
    Write-Host "üìÅ Export path:" -ForegroundColor Yellow -NoNewline
    Write-Host " (where files will be saved)" -ForegroundColor DarkGray
    Write-Host "   Press Enter to use default: .\azure-migration" -ForegroundColor DarkGray
    $inputPath = Read-Host "   Enter path"
    
    if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($inputPath)) {
        $ExportPath = ".\azure-migration"
    } else {
        $ExportPath = $inputPath
    }
    Write-Host ""
}

# === DISPLAY CONFIGURATION ===
Write-Host "üìã Configuration:" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host "   Tenant ID:      $TenantId" -ForegroundColor White
Write-Host "   Subscription:   $SubscriptionId" -ForegroundColor White
Write-Host "   Resource Group: $ResourceGroupName" -ForegroundColor White
Write-Host "   Export Path:    $ExportPath" -ForegroundColor White
Write-Host "   Skip Login:     $SkipLogin" -ForegroundColor White
Write-Host ""

# === VALIDATE AZURE CLI ===
Write-Host "üîç Checking Azure CLI..." -ForegroundColor Cyan

$azVersion = az version 2>$null | ConvertFrom-Json
if (-not $azVersion) {
    Write-Host "‚ùå Azure CLI is not installed or not in PATH." -ForegroundColor Red
    Write-Host "üí° Install via: winget install Microsoft.AzureCLI" -ForegroundColor Yellow
    exit 1
} else {
    Write-Host "‚úÖ Azure CLI version: $($azVersion.'azure-cli')" -ForegroundColor Green
}

# === CREATE EXPORT FOLDER ===
if (!(Test-Path $ExportPath)) {
    Write-Host "üìÅ Creating export folder: $ExportPath" -ForegroundColor Yellow
    
    try {
        New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $ExportPath -Force | Out-Null
        Write-Host "‚úÖ Folder created successfully!" -ForegroundColor Green
    } catch {
        Write-Host "‚ùå Error creating folder: $_" -ForegroundColor Red
        exit 1
    }
} else {
    Write-Host "‚úÖ Export folder already exists: $ExportPath" -ForegroundColor Green
}

# === LOGIN TO TENANT ===
if (-not $SkipLogin) {
    Write-Host "üîê Logging in to tenant: $TenantId" -ForegroundColor Cyan
    
    try {
        az login --tenant $TenantId
        
        if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) {
            throw "Login failed"
        }
        
        Write-Host "‚úÖ Login successful!" -ForegroundColor Green
    } catch {
        Write-Host "‚ùå Error logging in: $_" -ForegroundColor Red
        Write-Host "üí° Check if Tenant ID is correct" -ForegroundColor Yellow
        exit 1
    }
} else {
    Write-Host "‚è≠Ô∏è  Skipping login (using existing session)" -ForegroundColor Yellow
}

# === SELECT SUBSCRIPTION ===
Write-Host "üéØ Selecting subscription: $SubscriptionId" -ForegroundColor Cyan

try {
    az account set --subscription $SubscriptionId
    
    if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) {
        throw "Failed to select subscription"
    }
    
    Write-Host "‚úÖ Subscription selected successfully!" -ForegroundColor Green
} catch {
    Write-Host "‚ùå Error selecting subscription: $_" -ForegroundColor Red
    Write-Host "üí° Check if Subscription ID is correct and you have access" -ForegroundColor Yellow
    exit 1
}

# === CHECK IF RESOURCE GROUP EXISTS ===
Write-Host "üîç Checking Resource Group: $ResourceGroupName" -ForegroundColor Cyan

$rgExists = az group exists --name $ResourceGroupName
if ($rgExists -ne "true") {
    Write-Host "‚ùå Resource Group '$ResourceGroupName' not found." -ForegroundColor Red
    Write-Host "üí° Check the Resource Group name and try again" -ForegroundColor Yellow
    exit 1
} else {
    Write-Host "‚úÖ Resource Group found!" -ForegroundColor Green
}

# === LIST RESOURCES IN RESOURCE GROUP ===
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "üìã Resources in Resource Group:" -ForegroundColor Yellow
Write-Host "‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ" -ForegroundColor DarkGray

$resourceList = az resource list --resource-group $ResourceGroupName --output json | ConvertFrom-Json
az resource list --resource-group $ResourceGroupName --output table

Write-Host "‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ" -ForegroundColor DarkGray
Write-Host ""

# === DEFINE FILE NAMES ===
$templateFile = Join-Path $ExportPath "resource_template.json"
$backupFile = Join-Path $ExportPath "resource_template_backup.json"
$documentationFile = Join-Path $ExportPath "resource_documentation.md"

# === EXPORT ARM TEMPLATE ===
Write-Host "üì¶ Exporting ARM Template..." -ForegroundColor Cyan

try {
    az group export `
        --name $ResourceGroupName `
        --include-parameter-default-value `
        --output json > $templateFile
    
    if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) {
        throw "Failed to export template"
    }
    
    Write-Host "‚úÖ Template exported successfully!" -ForegroundColor Green
} catch {
    Write-Host "‚ùå Error exporting template: $_" -ForegroundColor Red
    Write-Host "üí° Some resources may not support export" -ForegroundColor Yellow
    exit 1
}

# === CREATE BACKUP ===
Write-Host "üíæ Creating template backup..." -ForegroundColor Cyan

try {
    Copy-Item $templateFile $backupFile
    Write-Host "‚úÖ Backup created successfully!" -ForegroundColor Green
} catch {
    Write-Host "‚ö†Ô∏è  Could not create backup, but continuing with main file" -ForegroundColor Yellow
}

# === GENERATE MARKDOWN DOCUMENTATION ===
Write-Host "üìù Generating resource documentation..." -ForegroundColor Cyan

try {
    $timestamp = Get-Date -Format "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss"
    
    $markdown = @"
# Azure Resource Group Export

## Export Information

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Date/Time** | $timestamp |
| **Tenant ID** | $TenantId |
| **Subscription ID** | $SubscriptionId |
| **Resource Group** | $ResourceGroupName |

## Exported Resources

| Name | Type | Location |
|------|------|----------|
"@

    foreach ($resource in $resourceList) {
        $name = $resource.name
        $type = $resource.type
        $location = $resource.location
        $markdown += "`n| $name | $type | $location |"
    }

    $markdown += @"


## Generated Files

| File | Description |
|------|-------------|
| ``resource_template.json`` | ARM template for import in new tenant |
| ``resource_template_backup.json`` | Template backup |
| ``resource_documentation.md`` | This documentation file |

## Next Steps

1. Run the import script in the new tenant
2. Provide the new Resource Group name
3. Verify all resources were created correctly

## Notes

- Some sub-resources (extensions, certificates, siteextensions) are not exported automatically
- Custom HTTPS configurations need to be reconfigured manually
- Managed Identities may need new permissions in the new tenant
"@

    $markdown | Out-File -FilePath $documentationFile -Encoding UTF8
    Write-Host "‚úÖ Documentation generated successfully!" -ForegroundColor Green
} catch {
    Write-Host "‚ö†Ô∏è  Could not generate documentation: $_" -ForegroundColor Yellow
}

# === SUMMARY ===
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê" -ForegroundColor Green
Write-Host "‚úÖ EXPORT COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY!" -ForegroundColor Green
Write-Host "‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê" -ForegroundColor Green
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "üìÑ Template:      $templateFile" -ForegroundColor White
Write-Host "üíæ Backup:        $backupFile" -ForegroundColor White
Write-Host "üìù Documentation: $documentationFile" -ForegroundColor White
Write-Host ""
Write-Host "üí° Next step: Run the import script in the new tenant" -ForegroundColor Cyan
Write-Host ""

# === RETURN INFO ===
$result = @{
    TemplatePath       = $templateFile
    BackupPath         = $backupFile
    DocumentationPath  = $documentationFile
    ResourceGroupName  = $ResourceGroupName
    ResourceCount      = $resourceList.Count
}

return $result

{"content": "# GitHub Copilot Instructions

Este arquivo cont√©m instru√ß√µes para o GitHub Copilot sobre como criar e manter scripts neste reposit√≥rio.

## üìã Vis√£o Geral do Projeto

Este √© um reposit√≥rio de scripts utilit√°rios para automa√ß√£o de tarefas de desenvolvimento e configura√ß√£o de ambiente. Os scripts s√£o projetados para serem:

- **Idempotentes**: Podem ser executados m√∫ltiplas vezes sem causar efeitos colaterais
- **Bil√≠ngues**: Vers√£o em portugu√™s (raiz) e ingl√™s (.english-version)
- **Multiplataforma**: PowerShell para Windows, Bash para Linux/macOS

## üèóÔ∏è Estrutura do Projeto

```

‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ azure/

‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ *.ps1

‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md

‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md
```

## üìù Padr√µes de C√≥digo

### PowerShell (.ps1)

```powershell
# Cabe√ßalho do script
# Script para [descri√ß√£o do que faz]
# Autor: [nome]
# Data: [YYYY-MM-DD]

# Cores para output (usar -ForegroundColor)
# Cyan    = T√≠tulos e informa√ß√µes principais
# Yellow  = Avisos e a√ß√µes em progresso
# Green   = Sucesso
# Red     = Erros
# White   = Informa√ß√µes secund√°rias
# Gray    = Prompts e textos auxiliares

# Emojis padronizados
# üîç = Verificando/Buscando
# üì¶ = Instalando/Pacote
# ‚úÖ = Sucesso
# ‚ùå = Erro
# ‚ö†Ô∏è = Aviso
# üí° = Dica
# üîÑ = Atualizando
# üöÄ = Iniciando/Executando
# üìÅ = Diret√≥rio/Pasta
# üîê = Seguran√ßa/Chave
# üê≥ = Docker
# ‚òÅÔ∏è = Cloud/Azure
# üé® = Tema/Visual

# Estrutura de verifica√ß√£o idempotente
if (Test-Condition) {
    Write-Host "‚úÖ J√° est√° configurado" -ForegroundColor Green
} else {
    Write-Host "üì¶ Instalando..." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    # c√≥digo de instala√ß√£o
}

# Tratamento de erros

    # c√≥digo
    Write-Host "‚úÖ Opera√ß√£o conclu√≠da!" -ForegroundColor Green

    Write-Host "‚ùå Erro: $_" -ForegroundColor Red
    exit 1

```

### Bash (.sh)

```bash
#!/bin/bash
# Script para [descri√ß√£o do que faz]
# Autor: [nome]
# Data: [YYYY-MM-DD]

# Cores para output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'

GRAY='\033[0;90m'

# Fun√ß√µes auxiliares (recomendado)
print_success() { echo -e "${GREEN}‚úÖ $1${NC}"; }
print_error() { echo -e "${RED}‚ùå $1${NC}"; }
print_warning() { echo -e "${YELLOW}‚ö†Ô∏è $1${NC}"; }
print_info() { echo -e "${CYAN}$1${NC}"; }

if command -v tool &>/dev/null; then

    verify_installation

```

## üîß Diretrizes para Novos Scripts

### 1. Idempot√™ncia

Todo script DEVE ser idempotente. Sempre verificar o estado atual antes de fazer altera√ß√µes:

```powershell
# PowerShell
if (-not (Test-Path $path)) {
    # criar arquivo/pasta
}

if (-not (Get-Command tool -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue)) {
    # instalar ferramenta
}
```

```bash
# Bash
if [[ ! -f "$path" ]]; then
    # criar arquivo
fi

if ! command -v tool &>/dev/null; then
    # instalar ferramenta
fi
```

### 2. Interatividade

Scripts devem funcionar com par√¢metros OU interativamente:

```powershell
# PowerShell - aceitar par√¢metro ou solicitar
param([string]$Email)

if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($Email)) {
    $Email = Read-Host "üìß Digite o email"
}
```

```bash
# Bash - aceitar argumento ou solicitar
email="$1"

if [[ -z "$email" ]]; then
    read -p "üìß Enter email: " email
fi
```

### 3. Feedback Visual

Sempre fornecer feedback claro sobre o que est√° acontecendo:

- Usar emojis consistentes
- Usar cores apropriadas (verde=sucesso, vermelho=erro, amarelo=aviso)
- Mostrar progresso em opera√ß√µes longas
- Exibir resumo ao final

### 4. Documenta√ß√£o

Cada pasta DEVE ter um README.md com:

- Descri√ß√£o dos scripts
- Par√¢metros/argumentos aceitos
- Exemplos de uso
- Requisitos/depend√™ncias

### 5. Bilinguismo

Para cada script em portugu√™s na raiz, deve existir uma vers√£o equivalente em ingl√™s na pasta `.english-version/`:

- Mesma funcionalidade
- Mensagens traduzidas
- README traduzido

## üìê Conven√ß√µes de Nomenclatura

- **Arquivos**: `verbo-substantivo.ps1` ou `verbo-substantivo.sh`
  - Exemplos: `install-docker.ps1`, `generate-ssh-key.sh`
- **Fun√ß√µes PowerShell**: `Verb-Noun` (PascalCase)

- **Fun√ß√µes Bash**: `snake_case`

- **Vari√°veis PowerShell**: `$PascalCase`
- **Vari√°veis Bash**: `snake_case` ou `UPPER_CASE` para constantes

## ‚úÖ Checklist para Novos Scripts

- [ ] Verifica pr√©-requisitos (permiss√µes, depend√™ncias)
- [ ] Usa cores e emojis consistentes

- [ ] README da pasta est√° atualizado
- [ ] Funciona com par√¢metros e interativamente

## üîÑ Manuten√ß√£o

Ao atualizar um script:

1. Atualizar AMBAS as vers√µes (portugu√™s e ingl√™s)
2. Manter a paridade de funcionalidades
3. Atualizar READMEs se necess√°rio
4. Testar em ambiente limpo (fresh install)

## üîí Seguran√ßa e Portabilidade

### Como obter o diret√≥rio do script:

## üîí Seguran√ßa e Portabilidade

### NUNCA incluir nos scripts:

1. **Dados sens√≠veis:**
   - Senhas, tokens, API keys
   - IDs de tenant, subscription, ou recursos espec√≠ficos

3. **URLs hardcoded de reposit√≥rios:**
   - ‚ùå `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/usuario/repo/...`
   - Use arquivos locais com `$PSScriptRoot` (PowerShell) ou `${BASH_SOURCE[0]}` (Bash)

### Como obter o diret√≥rio do script:


### Paths seguros para usar:
